thread.title: Kellyanne Conway: ‘I Meant to Say Masterminds or Terrorists and Not Massacre’
thread.title_full: Kellyanne Conway: ‘I Meant to Say Masterminds or Terrorists and Not Massacre’

author: Justin Baragona
title: Kellyanne Conway: ‘I Meant to Say Masterminds or Terrorists and Not Massacre’
text:
Kellyanne Conway: ‘I Meant to Say Masterminds or Terrorists and Not Massacre’ by Justin Baragona | 5:39   
After additional instances of her referencing to the arrest of two Iraqi refugees in Kentucky as the “Bowling Green massacre” or “Bowling Green attack” surfaced, White House counselor Kellyanne Conway provided a comment clarifying her remarks. 
As she did via Twitter and in an interview with Fox News , Conway chalked this up to her misspeaking, claiming that she merely meant to refer to the men as “terrorists” and not massacre. Below is a statement she sent to The Daily Beast’s Gideon Resnick regarding her comment: Conway gave me this statement just now: https://t.co/oLCvd4WbTm pic.twitter.com/aKMV9PkXuR 
— Gideon Resnick (@GideonResnick) February 6, 2017 
Conway has been under fire over the “Bowling Green massacre” since she mentioned it in an interview with MSNBC’s Chris Matthews when she complained about the lack of coverage given “after two Iraqis came here to this country, were radicalized and they were the masterminds behind the Bowling Green massacre.” 
It has since been discovered that while she has said she merely misspoke while speaking to Matthews, she actually referenced the nonexistent terror attack previous interviews with Cosmopolitan and TMZ. 
[image via screengrab]
